children.name: suggest
children.definition: to tell sb your ideas about what they should do, where they should go etc:
examples: The zoo asked its visitors to suggest a name for the new baby panda.

children.name: suggest (that)
examples: Her mother suggested that she should go and see the doctor.
I suggest you call him first.

children.name: It has been suggested that
examples: It has been suggested thatthe manager will resign if any more players are sold.

children.name: suggest doing something
examples: Tracey suggested meeting for a drink after work.

children.name: suggest how/where/what etc
examples: Can you suggest what kind of tool I should use?

children.name: can/may I suggest(= used to politely suggest a different idea )
examples: May I suggest that you think carefully before rushing into this?
►Do not say ‘suggest (someone) to do something’. Saysuggest doing somethingorsuggest that someone (should) do something.

children.name: make a suggestion
children.definition: to suggest sth that you think will help sb or will solve a problem:
examples: Mr Chairman - may I make a suggestion?

children.name: One day her mother made a suggestion. ‘Why don’t you come back and live with your father and me?’
examples: A professional consultant will make suggestions about the most suitable clients to approach foryour particular type of work.

children.name: recommend
children.definition: to suggestsomethingto someone because you know that it is good and you are sure that they will like it: giới thiệu, đề cử
examples: Can you recommend a good hotel near here?
I recommend the butter chicken – it’s delicious.

children.name: highly recommend
examples: This book is highly recommended by those who have used it.

children.name: heartily recommend
children.definition: strongly and enthusiastically
examples: I heartily recommend the cheese sandwiches.

children.name: thoroughly recommend
examples: Overall I can thoroughly recommend this film to anyone with an interest in space travel.

children.name: definitely/certainly recommend
examples: We would definitely recommend these books to students in fourth to sixth grade.

children.name: personally recommend
examples: Are there any hair colouring products you can personally recommend?

children.name: recommend sth to sb
examples: Corfu was wonderful - I’d recommend it to anyone.
I recommend this book to anyone with an interest in chemistry.

children.name: recommend something for sth/sb
examples: Which type of oil do you recommend for my car?
►Do not say ‘recommend someone something’. Just sayrecommend something, or sayrecommend something to someone.

children.name: nominate
children.definition: to state officially that a film, song, programme, etc. will be included in a competition for a prize: đề cử

children.name: nominate something for something
examples: The film was nominatedforan Academy Award.

children.name: suggestion
children.definition: an idea, plan, or possibility that sb mentions, or the act of mentioning it:
examples: Any suggestions would be welcome.

children.name: make a suggestion
examples: Can I make a suggestion?

children.name: offer/put forward a suggestion
examples: A few suggestions were put forward.

children.name: have a suggestion
examples: I have a suggestion for you.

children.name: come up with a suggestion
children.definition: think of something to suggest
examples: We’ve come up with five suggestions.

children.name: accept/adopt a suggestion
children.definition: do what is suggested
examples: The issue was finally settled when Amelia’s suggestion was adopted.

children.name: reject a suggestion
children.definition: not do what is suggested
examples: The government rejected the suggestion of a referendum.

children.name: be open to suggestions
children.definition: be willing to listen to suggestions
examples: We don’t have a firm plan yet, so we’re open to suggestions.

children.name: welcome suggestions
children.definition: be keen to listen to suggestions
examples: We welcome your comments and suggestions.

children.name: a good/excellent suggestion
examples: I think that’s an excellent suggestion.

children.name: a helpful/useful/valuable suggestion
examples: He made various helpful suggestions.

children.name: a sensible suggestion
examples: This was the first sensible suggestion she had heard from him.

children.name: a constructive/positive suggestion
children.definition: involving helpful ideas, not criticism
examples: Any evaluation should be fair and linked to positive suggestions for improvement.

children.name: a stupid/ridiculous suggestion
examples: It seemed a ridiculous suggestion.

children.name: a practical suggestion
children.definition: based on real situations, not just ideas
examples: What practical suggestions can you offer to teachers of children with learning difficulties?

children.name: suggestion that
examples: The committee rejected the suggestion that houses should be built on this site.

children.name: suggestion for
examples: Here are some suggestions for further activities.

children.name: suggestion about
examples: My suggestion about menus was ignored.

children.name: at sb’s suggestion
examples: She took a seat at his suggestion.

children.name: proposal
children.definition: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group: đề nghị, đề xuất
examples: They will consider our proposal at their next meeting.
proposal for
the government’s proposals for regulation of the industry
proposal to do sth
The committee put forward a proposal to reduce the time limit.
proposal that
They rejected proposals that the President should be directly elected.

children.name: make a proposal
examples: I'd like to make a proposal.

children.name: put forward/submit a proposal
examples: They put forward a proposal for a joint research project.

children.name: come up with a proposal
children.definition: think of one
examples: The sales staff came up with an innovative proposal.

children.name: draw up a proposal
examples: A committee of experts drew up proposals for a constitution.

children.name: approve/accept a proposal
examples: The proposal was approved by the committee.

children.name: support/back a proposal
examples: Not one of these organizations supports the government's proposals.

children.name: reject a proposal
examples: Councillors had twice rejected proposals for a new village school.

children.name: consider a proposal
examples: We shall consider their proposals carefully.

children.name: discuss a proposal
examples: He had discussed the proposal with the Egyptian president.

children.name: vote on a proposal
examples: Shareholders will vote on the proposal on May 5.

children.name: a detailed proposal
examples: They drew up a detailed proposal and submitted it to the Department of Energy.

children.name: a specific/concrete proposal
examples: The report will make specific proposals for further investigation.

children.name: a research proposal
examples: Applicants should submit a short research proposal on their chosen topic.

children.name: a budget/tax proposal
children.definition: a budget/tax plan
examples: Criticism of the budget proposals was voiced by the International Monetary Fund.

children.name: a peace proposal
children.definition: a plan to achieve peace
examples: The Israeli government responded positively to the US peace proposals.

children.name: a formal proposal
examples: Schools made formal written proposals.

children.name: recommendation
children.definition: a suggestion made, for example, by an official person or group, especially a suggestion that is contained in a report: đề nghị

children.name: make a recommendation
examples: The inspectors will make their recommendations to the Environment Secretary.

children.name: accept a recommendation
examples: The President accepted the report’s recommendations.

children.name: approve/adopt a recommendation
examples: The council approved the committee’s recommendation.

children.name: implement recommendations
examples: We will implement the recommendations of the Woolf Report to improve prison conditions.

children.name: the main recommendation
examples: One of the main recommendations in the report is more parental involvement in education.

children.name: specific/detailed recommendations
examples: We made a large number of specific recommendations for improving women’s mental health.

children.name: a clear recommendation
examples: The report offered no clear recommendations or policy guidelines.

children.name: on sb’s recommendation
examples: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.

children.name: proposition
children.definition: a plan of action that is suggested, especially in business or politics: đề nghị, gợi ý
examples: He telephoned Stuart with a proposition.

children.name: put a proposition to sb
children.definition: alsomake (sb
examples: a proposition)A proposition was put to Owen, and he is considering it.|I’m going to make you a proposition.

children.name: a business proposition
examples: Does this mean you’ve changed your mind about my business proposition?

children.name: a commercial proposition
children.definition: likely to be financially successful
examples: Gold mining is not a commercial proposition here.

children.name: an attractive proposition
examples: Setting up your own business is a very attractive proposition.

children.name: an interesting proposition
examples: A further study focussing on older people is an interesting proposition.

children.name: a practical/viable proposition
children.definition: likely to be possible or successful
examples: A complete ban on strikes is not a practical proposition.

children.name: to suggest sb as a suitable person for a job or official position
suggest
children.definition: to tell sb about sb that is suitable for a particular job or activity
examples: All members are invited to suggest names.

children.name: suggest sb for sth
examples: Robert suggested his son for the vacant directorship.
John Roberts has been suggested for the post of manager.

children.name: recommend
children.definition: to suggest sb you know personally as suitable for a job or position, because you think they would do a good job: giới thiệu, đề xuất
examples: Ask friends to recommend babysitters. That’s the safest way.
The first applicant was recommended by a friend of the boss.
Can you recommend a good lawyer?

children.name: recommend sb for sth
examples: Who would you recommend for this job, Stuart?

children.name: put sb’s name forward
children.definition: to formally suggest sb, usually in writing, to be elected to an official or political position:
examples: The local Democratic party has put several names forward.

children.name: put sb’s name forward for
examples: The opposition leader announced that he would not be putting his name forward for re-election at the party’s annual conference.

children.name: nominate
children.definition: to officially suggest sb for an election, job, position or honour: đề cử, đề xuất
examples: We need a treasurer. Does anyone want to nominate somebody?
nomination[C or U]C1an official suggestion of someone to do something
There have been two nominations for the new job.
His nomination as chief executive was approved by the board.
the Democratic nomination for President the person nominated by the Democrats

children.name: nominate somebody for something
examples: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.

children.name: nominate somebody as something
examples: She has been nominated as Best Actress for her part in the film ‘Forever Together’.
Would you like to nominate anyonefor/asdirector?

children.name: nominate somebody to do something
examples: I nominate John to represent us at the meeting.

children.name: propose
children.definition: to formally suggest sb for an official position:
examples: At the last meeting, Mrs Williams was proposed by several members.

children.name: propose for
examples: I would like to propose Mr Harrison for the position of Party Treasurer.

children.name: what you say to suggest sth
can I make a suggestion
children.definition: can/may I make a suggestion use this to suggest something politely, especially when you think someone may be making a mistake:
examples: ▪ Can I make a suggestion? Try adding a little more flour.
▪ May I make a suggestion? I think we should stop and look at the map.

children.name: I propose
children.definition: (that) spoken use this for formally suggesting something that you think should be done, especially at a meeting:
examples: ▪ I propose that we continue this meeting tomorrow.

children.name: why don’t you etc
children.definition: why don’t you/we/I etc informal say this when you think it would be a good idea to do something:
examples: ▪ Why don’t you wait for me downstairs? I won’t be long.
▪ If David wants someone to go with him, why doesn’t he ask Jacky? I’m sure she’d enjoy it.
▪ Why don’t we go watch a movie tonight?

children.name: what about
children.definition: how about/ informal use this to suggest something or offer something:
examples: ▪ ‘How about a brandy?’ said Tom.
▪ What about going out for lunch one day next week? When are you free?
How/What about?

children.name: used when suggesting or offering something to someone
examples: _How about a trip to the zoo this afternoon?

children.name: _"Coffee, Sarah?" "No, thanks." "What about you, Kate?"
examples: How about...?

children.name: informalused to make a suggestion
examples: _How about the cinema tonight?
_How about goingto the cinema?
what about?

children.name: used to suggest something
examples: _What about Lola - shall we invite her?
_What about taking a few days off?

children.name: maybe
children.definition: /perhaps  spoken use this to suggest something in a gentle way:
examples: ▪ Maybe we should try again tomorrow.
▪ Perhaps you ought to introduce her to my son. They should get on well.

children.name: let’s
children.definition: /lets/
examples: let’s go/have/do etc
use this when you want to suggest something that you and the people you are with should do:
▪ Come on, let’s dance.
▪ We both need a break. Let’s go away for the weekend.
let’s not
▪ Let’s not argue on our anniversary.
don’t let’s (British)
▪ Come on, don’t let’s waste any more time here.
let's
also formallet usused to express a suggestion or
request which includes you and the other person or people
_Let's go out to dinner.
_Let us consider all the possibilities.
_Let's not argue/UK alsoDon'tlet's argue.

children.name: we may as well
children.definition: use this to suggest something that is not very interesting or exciting, when you do not have any better ideas:
examples: ▪ It’s too late to go to the movies so we may as well watch TV.
▪ I think we might as well buy this one. We’re not going to find anything cheaper.

children.name: to make a formal suggestion in a meeting, report etc
propose
children.definition: to formally suggest that sth should be done, especially at a meeting:
examples: The Russians proposed a treaty banning all nuclear tests.
the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
the proposed budget cuts
propose (that)
I propose that we discuss this at the next meeting.
In his speech he proposed that the UN should set up an emergency centre for the environment.
propose doing something
The report also proposes extending the motorway.
►Do not say ‘propose someone something’. Saypropose something:He proposed a compromise (NOT He proposed me a compromise).
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually say that someoneputs forwardplans, ideas etc, rather thanproposesthem:

children.name: put forward
children.definition: to suggest plans, proposals etc, especially in order to start discussions about sth that needs to be decided: đưa ra
examples: The United Nations has put forward a peace plan that it hopes will form the basis for discussions.
Management initially put forward a number of proposals which were wholly unacceptable to the union.
The party has put forward new proposals to reduce the number of cars in the town centre.
The idea was first put forward by Aristotle.
A number of reasons have been put forward to explain these negative results.

children.name: put sth to
children.definition: /before to offer a group sth such as a proposal or plan which they can accept or refuse: đưa ra
examples: The Government has spent £1 million on putting its case to the public.
We’re going to put our plans before the committee on Monday and we’ll just have to hope that they are approved.

children.name: recommend
children.definition: to officially suggest that sth should be done, after you have considered the situation carefully:
examples: The report recommends a number of changes in the existing law.

children.name: recommend that
examples: The directors are recommending that shareholders accept Baldwin’s offer.

children.name: float
children.definition: float an idea/plan etcto suggest an idea, plan etc in order to find out what other people think about it:
examples: ▪ The administration had floated the idea of increased taxes on beer, spirits and tobacco.
▪ The following month, David floated the possibility of launching a new TV company.

children.name: submit
children.definition: to offer a proposal, application etc so that an official person or group can consider it and decide whether to accept it: trình, đệ trình, đưa ra
examples: Applications for planning permission must be submitted before noon tomorrow.

children.name: submit an application/claim/proposal etc
examples: All applications must be submitted by Monday.

children.name: submit something to somebody
examples: We have submitted proposals for a new pay structure to the board of management.

children.name: present
children.definition: to explain your ideas or plans to an official group so that they can decide whether to accept them: đệ trình
examples: We shall give you reasonable time to prepare and present your proposals.

children.name: present something to somebody
examples: Ms Rogers will present her ideas to the Board at next week’s meeting.

children.name: present somebody with something
examples: We have been presented with a number of plans and will give careful consideration to all ofthem.

children.name: moot
children.definition: be ed if an idea or plan is mooted, it is suggested as sth that could be done: được nêu lên
examples: ▪ The scheme was first mooted two years ago.

children.name: be mooted for
examples: ▪ A 3,000 house development has been mooted for the disused airfield.

children.name: proposed
children.definition: adjective đượcdự định
examples: _There have been huge demonstrations against the proposed factory closure.

children.name: motion
children.definition: nounSUGGESTIONsự đề nghị

children.name: nomination
children.definition: nounSUGGESTIONsự đề cử

children.name: an official suggestion of someone to do something
examples: _There have been two nominations for the new job.

children.name: hint
children.definition: nounINDIRECT STATEMENT

children.name: could
children.definition: modal verbSUGGEST

children.name: used for making a suggestion
examples: _We could go for a drink after work tomorrow, if you like.
_You couldalwayscall Susie and see if she might babysit.

children.name: offer
children.definition: noun
examples: when someone asks you if you would like to have something or if you would like them to do something
_"If you like I can do some shopping for you." "That's a very kind offer."
_I must say the offerofa weekend inBarcelonaquite tempts me.
_informalOne day I'lltakeyouup on(= accept) that offer.

children.name: maybe
children.definition: adverb

children.name: used to politely suggest or ask for something
examples: _Maybe Ted would like to go.
_Maybe we should start again.
